artist: Designer: Verner Panton; Manufacturer: Plus-Linje, Copenhagen, Denmark
creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: Model No. 8800. Stainless steel wire frame with wool upholstered seat and back with chrome-plated base. Variously known as the 'V-Chair.' Production continued to c.1966.
text: Highly futuristic, Verner Panton’s series of cone chairs resulted from a conscious effort to eliminate any preconceived notions of how a chair should look. Many designers in the 1950s and ’60s proposed alternatives to the traditional four-leg chair, and Panton’s “ice cream cone” solution became a hallmark of his chair designs. Panton also set himself apart from other Scandinavian designers by favoring steel wire and colorful plastics over wood.
title: Wire Cone chair
